review.title: Opinion mining of movie reviews at document level
review.abstract: The whole world is changed rapidly and using the current technologies Internet becomes an essential need for everyone. Web is used in every field. Most of the people use web for a common purpose like online shopping, chatting etc. During an online shopping large number of reviews/opinions are given by the users that reflect whether the product is good or bad. These reviews need to be explored, analyse and organized for better decision making. Opinion Mining is a natural language processing task that deals with finding orientation of opinion in a piece of text with respect to a topic. In this paper a document based opinion mining system is proposed that classify the documents as positive, negative and neutral. Negation is also handled in the proposed system. Experimental results using reviews of movies show the effectiveness of the system.

sections.text: DOI: 10.5121 / ijit.2014.3302 13Need for All. Web is used in all areas. Most people use Web for a common purpose such as online shopping, chatting, etc. During online shopping, many reviews / opinions are given by users that reflect whether the product is good or bad. These reviews must be researched, analyzed, and organized to allow better decision making. Opinion Mining is a natural language processing task that involves finding the orientation of opinion in a text section related to a topic. In this paper, a document-based opinion mining system is proposed that classifies the documents as positive, negative, and neutral. Negation is also treated in the proposed system. Experimental results based on reviews of films show the effectiveness of the system.KEYWORDS Opinion Mining, Sentiment Analysis, Reviews, Document, WordNet.

sections.heading: 1. INTRODUCTION
sections.text: A large number of reviews or suggestions about everything that is available on the web today; reviews can include reviews of products, users or critics of films, etc., which helps other users make decisions. Ratings grow faster by the day because each person likes to express their opinion on the Web. A large number of reviews are available for a single product, which makes it difficult for a customer to read all the reviews and make a decision. In this way, this data is evaluated, users "opinions are identified and classified as an important task. Opinion Mining is a Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Information Extraction (IE) task, which aims to obtain the writer's feelings in positive or negative comments by analyzing a large number of documents. It combines the techniques of computer linguistics and information processing (IR). The main task of sentiment analysis is to classify the documents and determine their polarity. Polarity is expressed as neutral, negative or negative.

sections.heading: 2. EXISTING RESEARCH WORK
sections.text: The most prominent work was done by Turney. [12] He uses "bad" and "excellent" seed words to calculate the semantic orientation, using the mutual information method to calculate the semantic orientation of a document. Sentiment orientation of a document was calculated as the average semantic orientation of all such sentences. Overall, the number of positive and negative adjectives is counted in a document to classify the documents. Harb et al. [1] used two sets of seed words with positive and negative semantic orientation to perform a blog classification.
